cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 mi WSW of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: meandering in the southern Bay of Campeche through Thursday, then forecast to lift northward across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: likely Louisiana coast (north-central Gulf Coast) – still beyond the 5-day cone

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning only from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico – no U.S. coastline under watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch – Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche coast now; potential north-central Gulf Coast (including Louisiana) late weekend into early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Possible with a Louisiana landfall but too early to quantify
weather_observation.wind: Small (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Sunday into Monday; otherwise breezy conditions only
weather_observation.storm_surge: No surge threat through at least Friday; minor to moderate surge possible this weekend if the storm approaches Louisiana
weather_observation.rainfall: Increasing rain bands could reach coastal Louisiana late Saturday-Sunday with potential for several inches of rain
weather_observation.other_hazards: Port operations may be affected by river rises from upstream rainfall and by offshore swell building in advance of the storm.
